Interface Wearables

All Known Implementing Classes:
OuraRing, WearablesAbstract
public interface Wearables
Interface for all Wearable Devices

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    getAPIKey()
    getter for the API_KEY In order for LLM to get access to the Wearable device data via the company's API a unique API key needs to be allocated to the user and device this should be passed by the user
    String
    getDeviceDescription()
    getter for the Device Description should be specified as a constant for developers will contain a 1-2 sentence description of the device and how the user primarily uses it
    String
    getDeviceIcon()
    Getter for the device ICON to show in the device list page and related pages This should be specified and defined as a constant for the developer in the sub-class level Must be GIF, JPEG, or PNG per ...
    String
    getDeviceID()
    getter for the device ID - this is a unique ID provided to the device upon purchase crucial for measuring equality between devices
    String
    getDeviceName()
    getter for the DeviceName - either OURARING, AppleWatch (class not yet supported)
    String
    getMetricDescriptions()
    A description of all the metrics from the device this is critical because each device/company has a unique list of sensor data that is offered by passing in the metric descriptions - the LLM will have better context on hwo to respond to certain questions
    void
    setAPIKey(String key)
    setter for the APIKEY will be useful for the "Edit Wearable Device Information" once available
    void
    setDeviceDescription(String description)
    Setter for the Device description as noted above this setter will be used primarily for editing an existing instance
    void
    setDeviceID(String ID)
    setter for the device ID will be called in the "New Device" form - not yet build

  • Method Details

    • getDeviceName

      String getDeviceName()
      getter for the DeviceName - either OURARING, AppleWatch (class not yet supported)
      Returns:
      toString of the DeviceName ENUM

    • getDeviceID

      String getDeviceID()
      getter for the device ID - this is a unique ID provided to the device upon purchase crucial for measuring equality between devices
      Returns:
      device ID

    • setDeviceID

      void setDeviceID(String ID)
      setter for the device ID will be called in the "New Device" form - not yet build
      Parameters:
      ID - - the passed in ID from the user

    • getDeviceDescription

      String getDeviceDescription()
      getter for the Device Description should be specified as a constant for developers will contain a 1-2 sentence description of the device and how the user primarily uses it
      Returns:
      the description of the device

    • setDeviceDescription

      void setDeviceDescription(String description)
      Setter for the Device description as noted above this setter will be used primarily for editing an existing instance
      Parameters:
      description - parameter for describing how the user utilizes this device

    • getDeviceIcon

      String getDeviceIcon()
      Getter for the device ICON to show in the device list page and related pages This should be specified and defined as a constant for the developer in the sub-class level Must be GIF, JPEG, or PNG per ...
      Returns:
      the png file path

    • getAPIKey

      String getAPIKey()
      getter for the API_KEY In order for LLM to get access to the Wearable device data via the company's API a unique API key needs to be allocated to the user and device this should be passed by the user
      Returns:
      the API Key for a specific device instance

    • setAPIKey

      void setAPIKey(String key)
      setter for the APIKEY will be useful for the "Edit Wearable Device Information" once available
      Parameters:
      key - - the new API Key that will replace the older one

    • getMetricDescriptions

      String getMetricDescriptions()
      A description of all the metrics from the device this is critical because each device/company has a unique list of sensor data that is offered by passing in the metric descriptions - the LLM will have better context on hwo to respond to certain questions
      Returns:
      - description of metrics in the developer defined formatting
